title: Poorly designed and translated app
text:
I recently set up the P1 HomeKit outlet. It was both a difficult process but also inelegant user experience. It took multiple tries to setup the P1 outlet with the app.

It's also clear that Koogeek is not experienced with properly localizing their app and website into English, as there are many grammatical errors throughout both.

I would suggest looking into other HomeKit power outlets with a better, more intuitive user experience.

title: So pleased with all my Koogeek products.
text: I can say without a doubt that Koogeek is the best brand of HomeKit devices and software. I have 4 devices including three smart outlets and a switch and they're all been stellar performers. The standard Koogeek app is great but I personally use the Home app by Apple. I recommend this brand to anyone taking the HomeKit plunge.

title: Abysmal App and Support
text: Having spent a week trying to get Koogeek to work again with Amazon Alexa, it has been a complete waste of time!  I own 4 P2 outlets and about a week ago they stopped working with Alexa. Despite several calls to Amazon (who at least tried to help), Koogeek customer support is non-existent. They send emails saying sorry for the inconvenience, but offer useless assistance. Despite telling them, all procedures have been followed, including disconnecting and reconnecting hardware and apps, still nothing! Interestingly, it works flawlessly with Siri, but nothing with Alexa. I explained that it worked previously, but it was like talking to a wall. They just don‚Äôt get it!  Numerous folks are encountering the same issue, so in an effort to save those who are considering buying this product, GO ELSEWHERE!  I resorted to buying the Belkin WEMO mini to see if worked with Alexa...yes it did, no problems. I‚Äôm hoping this stinging review will convey a message to Koogeek... get your act together with Amazon if you expect people to buy your product!

text: I generally like the app. It would be nice that in addition to the bar graph given for the energy consumption, if there were also the specific amount of energy usage by month instead of having to judge just from the graph. It would also be nice if the app would allow the device to fade in and fade out when turning on and off a lamp. Another suggestion would be to add the ability to set timers so a light could turn on and off at a specific time during the day.

title: Works like a charm!
text:
I love this plug.  Great price (Amazon $35) and handy plug to use for my portable air conditioner.

If you're looking to control this over 4G, try setting up Apple's HomeKit to run (by setting up the device with the same iCloud account) on an iPad or Apple TV 3 or 4 that you have on the same network.  That's how I'm able to control this plug remotely.
